definition: to bear shame and humiliation (idiom)
to keep/to contain/to suck (keep in your mouth without chewing)
dirt/disgrace
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
disgrace/dishonor/to insult/to bring disgrace or humiliation to/to be indebted to/self-deprecating/Taiwan pr. [ru4]

sentences.english: He had arrived at the hotel St. Gregory under a cloud.
sentences.chinese: 他是含垢忍辱到聖格雷戈裏飯店來的。

sentences.english: There is no retreat, but in submission and slavery!
sentences.chinese: 我們別無退路，否則只能含垢忍辱，淪爲奴隸。

sentences.english: The final proof lies in its ability to scale with shame and his career.
sentences.chinese: 最後的證明在於能夠含垢忍辱，無怨無悔。

definition: to bear humiliation to save one's skin (idiom)
to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence
to eat humble pie/to accept humiliation/to turn the other cheek
to endure humiliation
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
seeking only ease and comfort (idiom); making no attempt to improve oneself/taking things easily without attending to responsibilities
to drift through life
the country ruined and the people starving (idiom)
to swallow one's cries
see 苟且偷安[gou3 qie3 tou1 an1]
to have suffered all kinds of hardships (idiom)
(of a nation) to be destroyed/subjugation/vanquished nation
slave
to be fawningly submissive (idiom)
to keep one's emotions inside oneself/to restrain one's emotions
lit. to lie on firewood and taste gall (idiom); fig. suffering patiently, but firmly resolved on revenge
